Description: Body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery psykter; exterior, band of alternating red and black tongues above two lines at top of shoulder; below, black-figure symposion scene (male figure reclining on kline; face lost, turned back, with red on himation and kline; in front, red bowl filled with fruit or loaves on table)
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Fitzwilliam Museum, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
The sherd is published as possibly being a lekanis lid (CVA Cambridge II). For the identity as a psykter see D. Williams, in KuBA 5 (2015) 195, with fig. 14.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 348, no. B433)
CVA Cambridge II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain, Fascicule 11, Cambridge, Fascicule 2 (p. 39 - 40, pl. XX, no. 15)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0896)
